column1: History: Voss is a terrestrial planet in the Allied Tion sector of the Outer Rim Territories. By the time the Galactic Empire formed
column2: Voss was solely known as an unremarkable mining world. In the early years of the Galactic Empire
column3: the planet became part of the newly formed Allied Tion sector. The Empire attempted to create industries on the planet to rival Lianna
column4: however the planet came under the control of corrupt Tionese clans instead.

column1: Wellspring of Life;149;12057;Deep Core;389;458;Rim;188;Wellspring of Life (Unknown

column2: also known simply as the Force planet
column3: was one of many such nexuses of power that manifested in the depths of the galaxy. Jedi Master Qui-Gon Jinn was said to have discovered the legend of this world shortly before his death. The Wellspring of Life was eventually discovered by Yoda in the heart of the galaxy. Enveloped within a nebula of golden gas
column4: the Wellspring manifested itself as a planet of cracked rock.

column1: History: Wobani was a temperate planet partially hidden by a swirling dust cloud. The planet was used by the Galactic Empire as a site for labor and prison camps. Many pirates were sent there as the Empire cracked down on criminals in the Outer Rim.

column2: while attempting to persuade Hera Syndulla to leave Gorse with him
column3: Kanan Jarrus offered to take her there
column4: saying it was nice. Imperial Captain Rae Sloane later imagined that Count Denetrius Vidian's cyborg staff on Calcoraan Depot

column1: Wroona;198;11896;Mid Rim South;518;634;Core;191;"[CANON] Sector: Mid Rim South
History: Wroona is the homeworld of the near-Human Wroonians
column2: who are distinguished by their blue skin and yellow irises. It is a small blue world located at the edge of the inner rim. It is covered by oceans divided by long continents.

column1: History: An industrialized world in the outer rim. The planet is home to a large shipyard along side several other industrial operations. In 14 BBY
column2: members of the Free Ryloth Movement rebel cell
column4: hijacked an Imperial weapons shipment at the Yaga Minor shipyards and fled into hyperspace. Darth Vader pursued them and slaughtered Pok and his crew.

column1: Yag'Dhul;199;11897;Mid Rim South;499;631;Core;193;"[CANON] Sector: Mid Rim South

History: Yag'Dhul is the homeworld of the Givin species. The world is so harsh their organs are sealed away from the atmosphere and they could survive for some time in a Vacuum. It's 3 large moons produce tidal forces so extreme that the planets water and atmosphere are drawn to different parts of the planet
column2: leaving the lest of the world in Vacuum. The Givin live in hermetically sealed cities.

column1: History: Yavin 4 played an important role in galactic events
column2: including the seduction of Jedi Knight Exar Kun to the dark side and the destruction of Sith Lord Freedon Nadd during the Great Sith War
column3: the site of the eventual final death of the maddened Jedi Revan in the waning days of the Galactic War
column4: a ferocious duel between Jedi and Sith during the Clone Wars
column5: and serving as the base of the Alliance to Restore the Republic during the Battle of Yavin and as a battlefield in other battles of the Galactic Civil War. An attack was launched on the Death Star from this moon.

column1: History: The Yavin system was conquered by the Rakata during the reign of their Infinite Empire
column2: but later abandoned. After the Great Sith War
column3: Yavin Station orbited the planet and was used for corusca gem ""fishing"" until it blew apart in 3956 BBY and crashed on Yavin 22. In the year 0 BBY
column4: the Millennium Falcon orbited the gas giant to reach Yavin 4
column5: where the headquarters for the Alliance to Restore the Republic were located. Shortly after the Battle of Yavin
column6: Baron Orman Tagge constructed Achtnak Turbine Station
column8: from which he launched TIE attacks on Massassi Station
column9: Achtnak was destroyed by Luke Skywalker. Lando Calrissian later established GemDiver Station in the giant's orbit
column10: for the fishing of corusca gems. GemDiver Station was attacked by the forces of the Shadow Academy.

column1: History: The planet has a unique connection to the Force
column2: being balanced between the light and dark sides
column3: similar to Odessen. Legends speak of an ancient and advanced empire that once ruled this world. The Eternal empire as it was named was said to have once waged war with both the Republic and the Sith at some point
column4: however much of the story has been lost to time

column1: History: Zeltros is known as a luxury world
column3: owing to the planet's abundance of pleasurable facilities ranging from amusement parks to theaters

column1: History: Ziost once had a fertile environment
column2: until the Sith established their presence there and laid waste to the planet just as they did with Moraband
column4: and Asog. In the time of the Galactic Republic
column5: Ziost was quarantined along with the likes of Malachor
column8: and its affiliation to the Sith was hidden from history. Ziost was the original site of an ancient Sith ritual altar that was present in the Grand Republic Medical Facility on Coruscant in 19 BBY. Sometime between 0 BBY and 4 ABY
column9: CR-8R considered Fortress Vader on the planet Mustafar the spookiest Imperial stronghold this side of Ziost.

column1: History: Zonama Sekot was an astronomical object located in the Unknown Regions. It was situated in an otherwise empty and unexplored area
column2: in the neighborhood of the planets Ahch-To and Rakata Prime. The object is strangely reported to have been in different locations at different times throught galactic history.

column1: History: Zygerria was a prominent world in the outer rim and home to a slaver empire. However the Jedi order and the Republic brought this prominence to a close
column2: when they cracked down on slavery. However the Zygerrians rose again by allying themselves with the Confederacy
column3: who were more lenient to slavery.
